instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message:
I was using a working 3787 to compare measurements around L7130/L7520 when my probes slipped and shorted some things together (not sure what). The computer immediately shut down, and now when I boot it there is no display on the internal LCD as well as over HDMI with and without the LCD unplugged. It does seem to boot because it chimes and the volume keys work, and it responds to the ALS. I tried PRAM and SMC reset, nothing.

Is there any hope or is the GPU dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message:
More likely something in the MUXing circuit, voltage spike on 3V to one of the MUXes. This is going to suck.

Enable remote desktop on the OS and log into the machine to see if the GPU is recognized.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message:
How do you suggest I enable remote desktop? Boot the SSD in a working machine?

I'm getting 0v on <CAPACITOR>C8760</CAPACITOR> also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: That is controlled by <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> MUX. This whole circuit of MUXes is so complex, I don't even know exactly how it works. GPU getting core power?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: Again the enable comes from <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. Any of the 5 rails that <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> controls coming on? May only pulse once, as <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> might shut everything down when the PGOOD signals are not coming high, but not sure about that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: No, I don't think any of them are coming up. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU_MISC</SIGNAL> has ~0.38v on it if that means anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: Is there any chance this is BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: I'd like to hear your logic behind that besides it being easy........

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: It's the only thing in the area that could have been shorted with the probes?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: I'll give that a 1% chance. More likely there was a voltage spike on 3 or 5V bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: So I checked in system profiler and it doesn't see any GPU, only Intel Iris. Should I replace <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> or fucked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: I haven't checked yet if <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> is getting 3.3v on <RESISTOR>R9600</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R9601</RESISTOR> but I would assume so at this point. The only other thing I'm thinking it could possibly be is that somehow the backlight IC got fucked since it is in the area I was working in and is sending the wrong signal on the I2C bus to the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> mux and shutting it down. Would that make sense?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
threads.message: I doubt the BKL chip would cause this but you can pull <RESISTOR>R7781</RESISTOR>/82, should work without. Of course the GPU is not recognized, it is not getting power. Check power to <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display on internal or external
